revised_title: Effect of Phagostimulant Mixtures on Deterrent Receptors in Crucifer-Feeding Lepidopterous Species
tldr: This study investigates the effect of phagostimulant mixtures on deterrent receptors in two crucifer-feeding lepidopterous species, Mamestra configurata and Trichoplusia ni. The researchers found that phagostimulants, such as inositol, sucrose, and their combination, suppress the response of sinigrin-sensitive cells in both species. These findings provide a functional basis for understanding the deterrent effect of sinigrin in similar background mixtures.
